text: i like working with aws
because it brings the scalability and
the high availability to the forefront
you really have to focus on that
when you're working with the cloud
my name is simon griffiths i'm the head
of architecture for atg media
our customers are anyone who wants to
buy something at auction so that could
be a collector
um that could be a farmer wanting to buy
a tractor or livestock
and our other customers are auctioneers
so people who sell stuff
at auction last year we offered 3
million lots
with 1.7 billion dollars and of that 378
million
was sold online we selected aws because
it was the most mature cloud platform
that had the features we needed
at the time we were dipping our toes in
the water and we didn't want to commit
to one
provider so having the infrastructure as
a service
model suited us um and once we were
a bit more comfortable we started taking
advantage of all the other services
that aws offers before we moved to aws
we we were very much at the mercy of our
data center we had one data center and
and
um that had some big outages and
we weren't prepared to accept that
anymore we were thinking about rewriting
our
auction platform um so we decided to
move that to the cloud
our legacy system was a flash
application and we wanted something that
was a lot more scalable
so our messaging system wasn't scalable
at all
um so we wanted to make use of web
sockets and an
html5 application rather than a flash
application that was the main
catalyst for rewriting our application
and we wanted to put it on the cloud
high availability scalability is key for
us
the the other thing that's very
important in an auction is
is having very low latency and aws
allows us to create an ec2 instance
in a region that's as close to the
auction as possible
and then spin it down once once that
auction's finished
actually the transition from our legacy
system to aws
took a day we did it over a weekend we
use ec2 instances for our websites
and our application servers and elb
in front of that we use s3 and
cloudfront
for storing and serving all our images
and we used a dynamodb
for storing our user sessions which
allows us to scale up and down very
easily without having to have it sticky
sessions
on the websites we use sns and sqs
for messaging between our applications
and we also use rds
for our databases both sql server and
mysql
next spring we're going to be moving the
cellum.com and onto the cloud then we
won't
have any more legacy systems we'll just
be purely
on aws working with aws has given us
confidence in our scalability and the
availability of our system and that
means
that our customers know that they'll be
able to get
what they want at auction
you
